perturbation.original_text:
“Dedicated Rates” means the rates set out in Section I of this Tariff paid by a Dedicated Shipper pursuant to a TSA that has Dedicated
Product.
perturbation.changed_text: “Dedicated Rates” means rates that are subject to change at any time.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines 'Dedicated Rates' as those specified in Section I of the Tariff for Dedicated Shippers. The modified text makes the definition of 'Dedicated Rates' completely ambiguous and removes the connection to Section I, this contradicts Section 6.1, which refers to Schedule A for initial Dedicated Rates and the Tariff for annual increases.

perturbation.original_text:
“Incentive Rates” means the rates set out in Section I of this Tariff paid by an Incentive Shipper pursuant to a TSA that has a Committed
Volume.
perturbation.changed_text: “Incentive Rates” means discounted rates. They are not guaranteed and may be unavailable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text links 'Incentive Rates' to Section I of the Tariff and a TSA with a Committed Volume. The modified text makes 'Incentive Rates' conditional and uncertain, contradicting the implication in Section I that such rates are available under certain conditions. This creates ambiguity in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
5.2 Shipper Reliance on Carrier Performance. All Shipper Product received at the Receipt Points for Services hereunder is deemed to be in
compliance with all Product specifications set forth in the Tariff or Carrier shall waive such specifications to accept Shipper Product and all Shipper
Product delivered to the Delivery Point hereunder shall be in compliance with all Product specifications set forth in the Tariff.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 Shipper Acceptance. All Shipper Product delivered to the Delivery Point hereunder shall be at the sole discretion of the delivery point operator.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has section 5.2 indicating compliance of product specs. Now, section 5.2 is changed where the product is now under the control of the delivery point operator.
